result.execSummary:
All charges against Daniel William Matusek in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel William Matusek is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel William Matusek

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel William Matusek not in court.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Daniel William Matusek.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:21 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for 2nd status. Record by Atty. Lettenberger that State will be filing civil complaint. State provides copy of civil complaint to the Court and to Atty. Lettenberger. Atty. pleads guilty to the civil complaint on behalf of the defendant. Defendant to pay $500.00 forfeiture plus costs. CM file is dismissed. Court in recess.

Defendant Daniel William Matusek not in court - Authorization on file.  Attorney Francis R. Lettenberger in court for Daniel William Matusek.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken. Called @ 3:09 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for 1st status. Record by Atty. Lettenberger who is waiting for meeting with the prosecutor, which is set for tomorrow. Asks for additional status - court grants.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Amended signature bond filed with the court.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Hermann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel William Matusek in court. Attorney Frank Lettenberger for defendant. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Lettenberger. Argument, granted. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Victim in court, statement made. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Victim's Request to Lift the No Contact

*AMENDED 7-26-2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH K.R.W. dob 7-29-1991. NO THREATS OF VIOLENCE. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH K.R.W. dob 7-29-1991 OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Daniel W Matusek in court. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
